title: How to Spool Knit a Wire Chain

steps.headline: Thread the end of the wire down through the top of the dolly out the bottom.
steps.description: This is the tail of the chain.

steps.headline: Wrap the wire twice around one pin of the spool.
Lift the bottom loop up over the pin and top loop using the knitting needle.
Drop the loop into the middle.
Wrap the wire around the second pin twice.
Lift the bottom loop up over the top loop and drop into the middle.
When you reach the first pin, wrap the wire around the pin once.
steps.description: This will give two loops on the pin.

steps.headline: Lift the bottom loop up over the top loop and drop into the middle.
Repeat until the chain is the desired length.
Cut a long tail on the wire.
Remove the remaining loops from the dolly.
Thread the wire tail through the remaining loops to prevent them from unraveling.

text: Thread the end of the wire down through the top of the dolly out the bottom. This is the tail of the chain. Wrap the wire twice around one pin of the spool.  Lift the bottom loop up over the pin and top loop using the knitting needle.  Drop the loop into the middle.  Wrap the wire around the second pin twice.  Lift the bottom loop up over the top loop and drop into the middle.  Repeat with the remaining pins.  When you reach the first pin, wrap the wire around the pin once. This will give two loops on the pin. Lift the bottom loop up over the top loop and drop into the middle.  Repeat until the chain is the desired length.  Cut a long tail on the wire.  Remove the remaining loops from the dolly.  Thread the wire tail through the remaining loops to prevent them from unraveling.  Finished.
